SurveyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

SurveyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

SurveyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Contains the reference that identifies the survey instance.

Talent_Survey_Data.description: The ID of the survey. The ID is either a Workday ID or reference ID. Example reference ID: Survey_ID=12345
The instructional text of the survey.
If true, a survey recipient can only respond to the survey once.
The status of the survey. This is a read-only field.

Talent_Survey_Question_Data.description: The ID of the survey question. The ID is either a Workday ID or reference ID. Example reference ID: Survey_Question_ID=12345
The order to display the survey question.

Question_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Question_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Question_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Talent_Survey_Question_Data.description: The type of the question. Valid values: TEXT, DATE, NUMERIC, UPLOAD_ATTACHMENTS, MULTIPLE_CHOICE_SINGLE_SELECT, MULTIPLE_CHOICE_MULTI_SELECT.

Question_Display_OptionObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Question_Display_OptionObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Question_Display_OptionObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Talent_Survey_Question_Data.description: The display option of a multiple-choice question. Valid values: DROPDOWN, CHECKBOX, PILL, RADIO_BUTTON, SCALE.
If true, a survey recipient is required to answer this question.

The maximum number of selections for a multi-select question. This field is required for multi-select questions. This integer must be greater than 1 and equal to or less than the number of the multiple choice answers.

Survey_Question_Multiple_Choice_Answer_D.description: The ID of the multiple choice answer for the question. The ID is either the Workday ID or reference ID. Example reference ID: Question_Multiple_Choice_Answer_ID=12345.
The display order of the multiple choice answer.
The text of the multiple choice answer.
The score of the multiple choice answer.

Talent_Survey_Question_Data.description: Contains the question multiple choice answer data. You can't edit a multiple choice answer that's in use by another survey.

validation.validation: You can't add a multiple choice answer that's in use by another survey.
Specify only alphanumeric characters for Question Multiple Choice Answer Order.

Talent_Survey_Data.description: Contains the survey question data. You can't edit a question that's in use by another survey.

validation.validation: You can only specify Question Display Option when the Question Type is Multi-Select or Single-Select.
You can't add a question that's in use by another survey.
You can only specify Question Response when the Question Type is Multi-Select or Single-Select.
Specify only alphanumeric characters for Question Order.
Specify a valid Question Display Option: Checkbox, Pill are valid for Multi-Select.
You can’t specify an existing question from a non-survey source (Questionnaires, Feedback Templates, and so on) in a survey.
You can only specify Maximum Number of Selections when the Question Type is Multi-Select.
You can't specify duplicate answers in the same multiple choice question.
Specify a Maximum Number of Selections that is between 1 and the number of Question Responses.
Specify a valid Question Type: Text, Date, Numeric, Upload Attachments, Multiple-Choice Single-Select, Multiple-Choice Multi-Select.
Specify a valid Question Display Option: Dropdown, Radio Button, Scale are valid for Single-Select.
Specify between 1 and 10 Multiple Choice Answers for a Multiple Choice Question.

RoleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

RoleObjectID.type: WID,  Academic_Affiliate_ID,  Academic_Contact_ID,  Academic_Person_ID,  Applicant_ID,  Beneficiary_ID,  Business_Entity_Contact_ID,  Candidate_ID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Contingent_Worker_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Dependent_ID,  Emergency_Contact_ID,  Employee_ID,  Extended_Enterprise_Learner_ID,  External_Committee_Member_ID,  External_Learning_Instructor_ID,  External_Learning_User_ID,  Former_Worker_ID,  Instructor_ID,  Learning_Assessor_ID,  Learning_Instructor_ID,  LearningUserName,  Notification_System_Account_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Recruiting_Agency_User_ID,  RecruitingUserName,  Referee_ID,  Region_Reference_ID,  Service_Center_Representative_ID,  Student_ID,  Student_Proxy_ID,  Student_Recruiter_ID,  StudentUserName,  SupplierUserName,  System_User_ID,  System_User_OpenID,  System_User_OpenID_Connect_Internal,  System_User_OpenID_Internal,  Universal_Identifier_ID,  WorkdayUserName
RoleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

RoleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Share_Survey_Data.description: The Reference ID of workers who can view, edit, copy, share, launch, close and re-open this survey.

RoleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

RoleObjectID.type: WID,  Academic_Affiliate_ID,  Academic_Contact_ID,  Academic_Person_ID,  Applicant_ID,  Beneficiary_ID,  Business_Entity_Contact_ID,  Candidate_ID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Contingent_Worker_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Dependent_ID,  Emergency_Contact_ID,  Employee_ID,  Extended_Enterprise_Learner_ID,  External_Committee_Member_ID,  External_Learning_Instructor_ID,  External_Learning_User_ID,  Former_Worker_ID,  Instructor_ID,  Learning_Assessor_ID,  Learning_Instructor_ID,  LearningUserName,  Notification_System_Account_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Recruiting_Agency_User_ID,  RecruitingUserName,  Referee_ID,  Region_Reference_ID,  Service_Center_Representative_ID,  Student_ID,  Student_Proxy_ID,  Student_Recruiter_ID,  StudentUserName,  SupplierUserName,  System_User_ID,  System_User_OpenID,  System_User_OpenID_Connect_Internal,  System_User_OpenID_Internal,  Universal_Identifier_ID,  WorkdayUserName
RoleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

RoleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Share_Survey_Data.description: The Reference ID of workers who can view, launch, close, and re-open this survey. They can't edit, copy, nor delete the survey.

validation.validation: You can only specify workers when sharing a survey in this web service. You can share a survey with other person types through the Share Survey task in Workday.

Talent_Survey_Data.description: The link to access the Survey. This read-only field only exists if the survey was sent with a link.

If true, the specified survey is sent with a link. This field only applies if the survey is in "Draft" state. Once set, this field cannot be reverted to false, and the specified survey cannot be sent to specific organizations or individuals.

If true, the specified survey is immediately sent to the specified organizations and individuals. This field only applies if the survey is in “Draft” state. Once set, this field cannot be reverted to false, and the specified survey cannot be sent through a Survey Link or Schedule in Workday.

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Survey_Recipient_Data.description: The Workday ID or the reference ID of an organization to send the survey to.

Survey_AudienceObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Survey_AudienceObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Survey_AudienceObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Survey_Recipient_Data.description: The Workday ID of an individual to send the survey to.
If true, the specified organizations will include all subordinate organizations. Once set, this field cannot be reverted to false.
If true, the specified organization will include all contingent workers. Once set, this field cannot be reverted to false.

Talent_Survey_Data.description: Contains a collection of organizations and individuals to send the survey to. This field only applies if Survey Run Now is true. You can only edit recipients when the Survey Status is Draft.

validation.validation: You can only include subordinates when the survey is sent to an organization.
You can only include contingent workers when the survey is sent to an organization.
You can only edit a survey when the Survey Status is Draft.
You can only add recipients to a survey when Run Now is true.
You can't specify duplicate questions in the same survey.
Specify at least 1 Question to send the survey.

description: If true, the specified instance in the Survey Reference or the ID field of the Survey Data will be deleted. The specified ID must be valid. The specified survey must be in a "Draft" state.
